Name: Hilary Jackson
Job/Team Function: The Director General is accountable for the overall operation and performance of the Department. The Director General chairs the Management Board and is responsible for the day-to-day running of the Department. As Accounting Officer, the Director General is responsible to Parliament for the management and organisation of the Department, including the use of public money and the stewardship of its assets.

Constitution and Politics Group (CPG) is responsible for advising on the implementation of the agreements and on other constitutional and devolution issues, and on providing advice and analysis to Ministers and officials on the political climate in Northern Ireland. CPG is comprised of approximately 35 staff, working in both Belfast and London. CPG looks after policy relating to Northern Ireland election and human rights, and has some responsibility for equality matters. It sponsors the Northern Ireland Human Rights Commission, the Boundary Commission for Northern Ireland, and the Electoral Office for Northern Ireland. It is also responsible for arranging and supporting VVIP visits.
